msgSnippet: hi thomas, My problem is solved. I had put my jars in weblogic classes directory as .jar file itself. But Weblogic wants the jar file to be extracted into the

hi thomas,

My problem is solved.
I had put my jars in weblogic\classes directory as
.jar file itself.
But Weblogic wants the jar file to be extracted into
the weblogic\classes dir.

Thanks Thomas, and sorry to bother you.

Siju.


--- tsmets@... wrote:
> 
> Why don't you give a more accurate description of
> the problem ?
> It could be a JNDI problem, a run-time classpath
> problem, ... Can you run a HelloWorld ?
> Is you JNDI server well accessible from the Test ?
> 
> Thomas,
